lines.text: Let Me tell you a story. Dinosaurs ruled our planet for millions of years and yet they died out almost over night. Why? The evidence suggests that a meteor fell to Earth carrying an alien bacteria.
Plague? Is that what this whole thing is about?
Prevention!
And you think that this meteor brought some kind of killer germ?
It's something I've expected and prepared for all my life!
Your meteor brought something all right but if it's a germ, it's the biggest son of a bitch you've ever seen!
Let's scrag that son-of-a-bitch!
[the soldiers fire their weapons into the manhole]
SENSOR CHARGE! SHORT FUSE! FIRE IN THE HOLE!
[Drops the explosive into the manhole and it detonates]
Chew on that, slimeball!
[after a pause, the ground all around them begins to tremor violently]
What's happening?
I think... you pissed it off!
The front door is locked.

[picks up a brick]
That's okay, I got a key.
In the meantime, we're your prisoners?
Not at all, you're my patients.
Dr. Meadows, just for the record, I don't agree with any of this. Those people's lives are at stake.

Don't you think I know that? This isn't one of you text-book exercises, Mr. Jennings. This is an experiment in biological warfare, or hadn't you noticed? That organism is potentially the greatest breakthrough in weapons research since man split the atom. What we do here will affect the balance of world power! Of course there are lives at stake - whole nations, in fact. And that's far more important than a handful of people in this small town. And that is my cross to bear, Mr. Jennings. Now carry out your orders.
I feel like the one-legged man in an ass kicking contest.

[to Meg]
I never thought I'd go out of my way to find a cop.
Listen to me, Briggs, think for a minute, do you suppose an army of guys in plastic suits show up every time a meteor falls?

[about Brian]
Shoot him, that's a direct order!
How do you think they got here so fast? How did they even know when to come?
Shoot dammit shoot!
I'll tell ya how! That meteor is man-made! It's some kind of a germ warfare test they fucked up!
Kevin, don't eat with your face.
Mom, we're in a hurry so we can go bowling with Anthony.
And then to the movies.
What movie?
Garden Tool Massacre, it's your basic slice and dice.
Your basic what?
Well this guy in a hockey mask, he chops up a few teenagers, but don't worry, there's no sex or anything bad.
They won't let you kids into a movie like that.
No problem, my brother's an usher.
No. Absolutely not.

[Indicating to a pipe whilst chest deep in sewer water]
Come on... that's our only way out of here
[Moving past some sewer rats]
Watch out for the rat.

[Confused]
What rat?
[They look round to see the rats being consumed by the blob as it heads for them. Meg screams]
RUN!

[Pokes his head around his front door]
Who are you?
I'm Paul is you're sister in?
Just a second.

[as the blob besieges the town hall]
Bring some more!
[Fire extinguishers]

[on seeing the blob shatter and explode from the exposure to the canister of liquid nitrogen]
WOOAAHHH
[runs up and hugs his sister]
Brian! I need to talk to you. Brian?
What the hell are you doing here?
Look, I came down to bail you out.
[holds out credit card]
Who do you think they are, Neiman Marcus? They don't take plastic.
Nobody believes me about what happened tonight.
What did happen?
You were there, you saw!
All I saw was an old man with a funky hand, that's all I saw.
The thing on that man's hand killed him and then it killed Paul, and whatever it is, it's getting bigger!
So you told the cops? Do you mind if I ask you a personal question? I know you're the homecoming queen type and all but are you strung out on something or what?

[laughs]
You're just the same.
What are you talking about?
You act like you're different, you put on this big show, but you're just like everybody else in this town, you're full of SHIT, Flagg!
We've had a car accident, this guy needs to see a doctor.
He has something on his hand, some kind of acid, or something.
Does he have Blue Cross?
I don't know.
Medical insurance of any kind?
Look, we don't even know who the guy is!
It's locked.
So what? Brian, what is with you? You're acting like a complete jerk.
I have a problem with authority figures.
What are you doing?
I think we ought to get out of here. We ought to take my bike and blow this town. It's getting a little thick around here. Don't you think?
That's crazy. These people are here to help us.
Come on Meg, we don't even know who they are. NASA, CIA, Royal Canadian Mounties, all I know is I saw a bunch of unmarked trucks back there, I think the whole thing stinks.
Are you coming?
Brian, I have to go back, my family's there, people that I care about.
Well I'm going, and if you're smart you'll come with me.
Then go. Take care of yourself. That's the only thing you're really good at, isn't it?
You want the ribbed or the regular?
Ribbed I guess.
[to Reverend Meeker]
They're not for me.
Flag's a punk, but he's no killer.
I think it's a mistake.
You don't give up, do you?
I need your help.
The organism is growing at a geometric rate. By all accounts, it's at least a thousand times its original mass.
This will put U.S. defense years ahead of the Russians.
I want that organism alive.
What about the civilians?
They're expendable.

[to the people of Aborville]
It's a lie. All of it.

[to Deputy Bill Briggs]
It can't stand the cold.

[near tears]
I'll be good I swear... I'll never see a movie ever again.
It's gonna be okay.
Sir, excuse me, but I think my little brother's over at the movie theatre on Main Street.
We're doing by sector. We'll be there soon.
Right, but you don't understand...
We'll handle it okay, now get back in line.
I don't see you handling much of anything... are you on a coffee break?

[Now irritated]
Look mister

[Snaps]
Don't you look mister me... I'm a tax payer... I pay your salary... now what are you going to do about finding my son?

[as her father argues with the soldier... Meg takes off into the crowd]
I understand you're upset, Sir, but if you just get back in line. We have the situation under control.

[Grudgingly]
I know.

[Concluding his speech to his doomsday congregation]
Consuming sinner and saint alike... who shall be lifted up to rapture when the judgment trumpet blows? None but the faithful brothers and sisters... None but the faithful.
[last lines]
When Reverend?

[Looks up to reveal his right eye is now a mass of burnt tissue]
Maam?
The day of reckoning. How far off?
Soon Maam... Soon
[Holds up a jar in his badly burnt right hand]
The Lord will give me a sign.
[Peers inside and we see a piece of the blob moving around inside]

[Meg rescues Kevin from the sewers but then can't get out herself. Kevin tries to save her anyway, to no avail]
Run, Kevin! Go to Town Hall!
No, but Meg...
[then, before he can respond]
DO IT NOW!

[gets up, resignedly]
I'll miss you, Meg.
[as he runs off, Meg dives back into the sewer and swims for it; sure enough, she finds an alternate way out]
[first lines]
That's a first down. Ball at a thirty five-yard line.

[as snowflakes fall to the ground from the blob's demise]
Hey man I told you we'd have snow... gotta have a little faith... I hope I'm covered for this sort of thing.
[Indicating to the blob's shattered frozen remains]
Hey bring the dump truck... we've gotta have this thing moved by dawn.
Daddy, I'd like you to meet my friend Paul.
[notices Paul who bought condoms in his store earlier]
Ribbed.
Flagg! What'd you do to him?
Hey I'm not the one who bounced him off my car!
YEAH RIGHT! You ran him into the middle of the road!
Stop it! Let's get him to a doctor!
The sky, it fell from the sky!
What's he saying?
He's in shock, let's just go!
Hey, get in the car.
What for?
There's going to be a lot of explaining to do and you're part of it, now are you gonna get in the car, or am I going to make you get in?
What's the matter, Taylor? You worried about a little insurance claim on daddy's car, huh? Maybe I will come along, just to make sure you don't try pinning this whole thing on me.
Flagg! What are you doin' here boy?
The men from Glad here are showin' us how to keep our leftovers fresh.
